isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE AND VEHICLE FEATURES - Standard Features - Coolant Temperature Compensation (Engine Over Temperature Protection System)

svcproc.title: Coolant Temperature Compensation (Engine Over Temperature Protection System)
svcproc.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation reduces fuel delivery if Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) is above cooling system specifications.

Before standard engine warning or optional warning/protection systems engage, the reduction in fuel delivery begins when ECT reaches approximately 107°C (224.6°F). A relatively rapid reduction of 15% will be achieved as ECT reaches approximately 109°C (229°F).

note.para: Coolant Temperature Compensation may be disabled in emergency vehicles that require 100% power on demand.
